security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate data querying tool for FDA public databases. The code only connects to the official api.fda.gov endpoint. It creates a local cache directory and reads an optional API key from environment variables. No credential theft, data exfiltration, or suspicious execution patterns detected.

content.user_title: Query FDA databases for drug and device safety data
content.value_statement: Access comprehensive FDA regulatory data including adverse events, recalls, drug labeling, and device approvals. This skill enables pharmacovigilance research and regulatory compliance checks through a unified Python interface to the openFDA API.
actual_capabilities: Query drug adverse events and safety profiles from FAERS database
Access medical device adverse events, 510(k) clearances, and recalls
Retrieve drug labeling information including warnings and indications
Search food and dietary supplement recall and adverse event data
Look up substances by UNII codes, CAS numbers, and chemical structures
Monitor animal veterinary drug adverse events by species and breed
limitations: Only accesses public FDA data; confidential or pre-approval data not included
Rate limited to 240 requests per minute (120,000 per day with API key)
Historical data accuracy depends on FDA source data quality
Does not provide medical advice or clinical recommendations

use_cases.title: Drug safety monitoring
use_cases.description: Track adverse events, identify safety signals, and analyze drug reaction patterns over time

use_cases.title: Device surveillance
use_cases.description: Monitor device recalls, check 510(k) clearance status, and review adverse event reports

use_cases.title: Compliance tracking
use_cases.description: Verify approval histories, check enforcement actions, and track substance identifiers

prompt_templates.title: Drug safety query
prompt_templates.scenario: Find adverse events for a drug
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the FDA database skill to find all adverse event reports for [drug name] in the past year. Show the most common reactions.

prompt_templates.title: Device recall check
prompt_templates.prompt: Query the FDA database for recall information about [device name]. List any Class I recalls in the last 6 months.

prompt_templates.title: Drug label lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up the FDA label for [drug name]. Extract the indications, warnings, and contraindications.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the safety profiles of [drug 1] and [drug 2]. Show total events, serious events, and most common reactions for each.

output_examples.input: Find adverse events for aspirin and show common reactions

best_practices: Register for a free FDA API key to increase rate limits from 1,000 to 120,000 requests per day
Use specific field searches rather than broad wildcards for faster and more accurate results
Implement caching for frequently accessed data to reduce API calls and improve performance
anti_patterns: Using overly broad wildcard searches that return millions of results and hit rate limits
Making requests without handling errors or implementing retry logic for transient failures
Assuming FDA data is complete or real-time; there may be delays in reporting and data updates

faq.question: Is an API key required to use this skill?
faq.answer: No, but it is recommended. Without a key, you get 1,000 requests per day. With a key, you get 120,000 requests per day.

faq.question: What data sources does this skill access?
faq.answer: It queries the openFDA API which includes drug events, device events, food events, substance data, and animal veterinary events from official FDA databases.

faq.question: Can I get real-time safety alerts?
faq.answer: The skill provides access to FDA data but there may be delays between events occurring and appearing in the database. Always check FDA.gov for official alerts.

faq.question: Is my query data stored or shared?
faq.answer: Queries are made directly to the FDA API. No query data is stored or shared by this skill beyond optional local caching.

faq.question: Why did my query return no results?
faq.answer: Try broader search terms, check spelling, or use wildcards. Some drugs have different brand names in the database.

faq.question: How does this compare to Drugs@FDA?
faq.answer: This skill accesses openFDA which provides API access to public FDA data. Drugs@FDA is a separate FDA website with additional regulatory documents not available via API.
